intro: Trichoscypha chevalieri, commonly known as the African olive, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
